item.title: checked and unchecked keywords
item.description: Daily Knowledge Drop The checked and unchecked C# keywords, can be used to control overflow checking when working with integral type arithmetic operations and conversions: checked: is used to explicitly enable overflow checking unchecked: is used to suppress overflow-checking checked The checked keyword is used to explicitly enable overflow checking. Consider the following: 1 2 3 4 5 int maxInt = Int32.MaxValue; Console.WriteLine(maxInt); maxInt = maxInt + 10; Console.
